Question: What are the Sustainable Development Goals?
Option A: The goals to end poverty and hunger, and protect people from climate change.
Option B: A plan for leaders to come together and discuss the future.
Option C: An ambitious plan to make sure everyone has access to clean water and education.
Option D: Organizations working to fulfil the SDGs by the year 2030.

Question: What are the sustainable development goals and what is UNDP's role in achieving them?
Option A: To eliminate poverty and hunger, and protect people from climate change
Option B: To help nations make the SDGs a reality by 2030
Option C: To champion the SDGs so that people everywhere know how to do their part

Question: What are the Sustainable Development Goals?
Option A: To rid the world of poverty and hunger, and be safe from the worst effects of climate change
Option B: A set of 17 goals for a better future
Option C: A plan to achieve sustainable development by the year 2030
Option D: A global movement aimed at achieving the SDGs by the year 2030 in nearly 170 countries and territories

Question: What is the main goal of the Sustainable Development Goals?
What is the goal of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)?
Option B: To reduce poverty and hunger worldwide.
Option D: To achieve all of the above by 2030.

Question: What are the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)?
Option A: A set of goals for reducing poverty and hunger in the world by 2030.
Option B: A plan to eliminate all forms of discrimination in society.
Option C: An initiative to combat climate change and protect the environment.
Option D: A campaign to promote gender equality and empower women worldwide.
